intro: Varthemia conyzoides, commonly known as the common blueweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Africa, southern Europe, and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a fuzzy texture. Varthemia conyzoides is known for its adaptability to various soil types and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields.
